mdRecord.dcterms:title: Carrel 4-9, lower shelf|front edge
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Donohue, Liam Patrick [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Delta Delta Delta sorority, to which someone responds with an actual doodle of a poop emoji. "Bro" stylized partially in Greek letters, to which someone responds with the (Ancient?) Greek word for 'brother.' Advice to avoid majoring in math (beginning visible in previous photograph), to which someone responds affirmatively that they have done so. A phrase that mostly appears to be French, meaning 'either rage or despair' [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]
ΔΔΔ → [doodle of poop emoji] | BrΩ fo life ← ἀδελφύς | Never be a math major ← done | o rage o desespoir
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Greek letter societies
Education, Higher
Interpersonal relations
Despair
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: University of Virginia. Library. New Stacks. Charlottesville, Virginia, United States
